page.title: 07HARBOUR -(IRVINE)
page.content: {In the past Irvine harbour was the {main port for GLASGOW}exporting herring ,wool and hides.Centuries later bricks,timber,sulphur,potash and clay were imported for the chemical and building trades. Unfortunately the harbour is narrow and fills up with silt .However a pilot,John Darragh is employed by I.C.I.to guide ships from the harbour,although in former times he worked on the dredger. Fifty six ships a year take explosives from the wharf at I.C.I.to England.This makes our harbour dangerous and limits the number of people allowed in the MAGNUM when ships are being loaded.{In the future {it is expected that one of the docks {in the city of LONDON will get a {licence to load these cargoes.WHAT {WILL HAPPEN TO OUR HARBOUR THEN? }
